images.caption: Figure 2:The architecture of multi-teacher knowledge distillation framework for 3DGS. It consists of two stages. First, a standard teacher modelGs​t​dG_{std}is trained, along with two variants:Gp​e​r​bG_{perb}with random perturbation andGd​r​o​pG_{drop}with random dropout. Then, a pruned student modelGs​t​dG_{std}is supervised by the outputs of these teachers. Additionally, a spatial distribution distillation strategy is introduced to help the student learn structural patterns from the teachers.
Figure 4:Visualized comparison on theBicycle,Garden, andKitchenscenes. As shown in the rendered images and corresponding local regions, the proposed method can better capture fine details.
Figure 7:Visual comparison with different teacher models. Without the guidance of diverse teacher models, the rendering quality of the student 3DGS model gradually deteriorates.
